name: Never Never Plant
climate: The Never Never Plant thrives in a tropical climate with warm temperatures.
It requires high humidity levels similar to its native rainforest habitat.
Temperate climates are also suitable if they have few temperature extremes.
Avoid exposure to cold drafts or prolonged exposure to low temperatures.
sunlight: Prefers bright, indirect sunlight but can tolerate some shade.
Direct sunlight can scorch the leaves, causing browning or fading colors.
Artificial fluorescent lighting can also support its light requirements.
It thrives in environments with dappled sunlight akin to forest understory.
watering: Water consistently to maintain evenly moist soil without being soggy.
Allow the top inch of soil to dry out slightly between waterings.
Overwatering can lead to root rot, a common issue with these plants.
In winter months, reduce watering as the plantâ€™s growth rate decreases.
soil: A well-draining potting mix with a peat moss base is ideal for growth.
Avoid heavy soils which can retain too much moisture and cause rot.
Mixtures that replicate rainforest soil with high organic content work best.
Incorporate perlite or sand to enhance drainage and prevent compaction.
toxic: The Never Never Plant may cause irritation if ingested by pets or humans.
extra_care_tip: Regularly wipe the leaves with a damp cloth to remove dust and improve humidity.
